    • Constructor Detail

      • JobExecutionRequest

        public JobExecutionRequest(java.lang.String jobName,
                           java.lang.String jobLabel,

        Creates the request without cluster node preference.
        See Also:
        JobExecutionRequest

      • JobExecutionRequest

        public JobExecutionRequest(java.lang.String jobName,
                           java.lang.String jobLabel,
                           java.util.Map parameters,
                           NodeSelector nodeSelector)
        Constructor.

        Given job parameters can be of any type - system will try to convert them to proper values upon creation of IJobUnit. Mapping from parameter name to set method follows Java Beans convention: first character is capitalized and set is prepended.

        Parameters:
        jobName - job name (see IJobUnitFactory.getName())
        jobLabel - job label (see IJobUnitFactory.createJobUnit(String))
        parameters - job parameters as Map between String key and Object value
        nodeSelector - cluster node selector (see getNodeSelector())
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if jobName is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if jobLabel is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if parameters is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if nodeSelector is null
        Since:
        3.8.0

      • getNodeSelector

        @NotNull
public NodeSelector getNodeSelector()
        Determines on which node the job should run in a cluster setup. Note that in order to run a job on a remote node it is required that all the job parameters are serializable.
        Since:
        3.8.0
